holidays.name: International Day of Persons with Disabilities
holidays.description: A day to promote awareness, understanding, and support for the rights and well-being of persons with disabilities worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 1992 to foster inclusion and accessibility.
holidays.funFact: In 2019, the theme was 'The Future is Accessible,' highlighting technology's role in empowering people with disabilities.

holidays.name: Make a Gift Day
holidays.description: An unofficial day dedicated to the joy of crafting and giving handmade gifts during the festive season.
holidays.origin: Originated from the desire to encourage creativity and personal touches in gift-giving rather than just buying.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that handmade gifts often have more sentimental value and can boost relationships!

holidays.name: National Roof Over Your Head Day
holidays.description: A quirky observance reminding people to be grateful for having shelter and to think about the homeless.
holidays.origin: An informal day used by some to encourage acts of kindness and awareness of homelessness during winter.
holidays.funFact: Winter months tend to see a spike in homelessness-related charity drives coinciding with this day.

holidays.name: National Day of the Ninja
holidays.description: A fun and offbeat day to celebrate the legendary stealthy warriors of Japan and embrace your inner ninja.
holidays.origin: Created in 2003 by the Ninja Coalition to honor ninja culture and history.
holidays.funFact: On this day, some enthusiasts dress entirely in black and practice ninja-themed activities worldwide!

holidays.name: National Roof-Over-Your-Head Day
holidays.description: A strange but important observance to appreciate the simple but vital comfort of having a roof over your head.
holidays.origin: Started as a grassroots awareness day about homelessness safety during the winter.
holidays.funFact: In some communities, it's used as a day to volunteer at shelters or donate warm clothing.
